attributes.action: Get the BBC to stop advertising Comercial Shows
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The BBC has been criticised by actor and director Kevin Spacey over talent shows such as Any Dream Will Do. 

Spacey, who is artistic director of the Old Vic theatre in London, said that the programmes were 'essentially a 13-week promotion for a musical'. 

The BBC replied that the shows, which search for the next star for big west end musicals, were not 'unduly promotional'. 

Lets get these "STARZ in THEIR EYES - JUST JACK"  Of main stream BBC and quality back on TV. 
Just because a lot watch a show dosn't mean it any good, just means their bored or don't know any better.
Too many kids dream unduley beyond their talent and use these as a way to get out of doing education

reasons: Outside the remit of the Prime Minister and Government
